entry.def: A lab is the same as a laboratory .
In Britain, Lab is the written abbreviation for (书面缩略=) Labour.

Sentence.sentence: He needs to spend more time in the lab.

So someone leaving university who already has the skills needed to work in an industrial lab has far more potential in the job market than someone who has spent all their time on a narrow research project.
My first year of medical school counted as my senior year, which meant I had to take three to four labs a week to get all my sciences in.
There's an unpleasant factor when people find out meat is grown in a lab.
The head technician in the lab tried to persuade the hospital administration to replace it, but they are trying to cut costs.
